ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about the issues transgender people, especially transgender women and transfeminine people, have faced historically and the issues they continue to face today. I also learned a lot about the theory involved in transgender and queer thought/cultural production.
This class provided an incredible foundation for trans history, trans theory, and trans cultural production.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course content was kind of weird because it bounced back and forth between theory and poetry. I think I would have preferred to see a narrower focus in the material we studied. However, I think a lot of the work we read was very important and valuable, especially theory from trans people of color and indigenous two-spirit people.

Professor Peterson could improve the course most by redesigning the syllabus to match her strengths and interests instead of using the syllabus designed by the previous instructor. I imagine this is what she'll do in future semesters.
This course was very ill-organized. It was constantly being reorganized.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This was an excellent course to take, especially as a trans* person. Highly recommend, especially if professor Peterson is teaching it again.

Really great class to be trans in. Would definitely recommend for trans/queer folks (and allies who are wiling to learn) because the classroom environment is A+, and you learn a lot about trans history and queer theory. Despite it being a 300 level WGSS class, I think you can get by without a whole lot of WGSS theory/knowledge, so don't let the numbering scare you from taking it!
Yes-- anyone interested in gender studies or LGBT issues should absolutely take this course.
